intro: Paronychia orthoclada, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Paronychia orthoclada is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its hardy nature.
